Note: Participant experiencing frustration with swiping hand gestures
Participant describes photo and video quality as appearing to have a filter over them (hue and color undertones)
Participant noticed that tightening neural band helped register hand gestures but it felt uncomfortable
Participant loosened neural band to reduce physical discomfort but notices less registration of hand gestures
Participant attempting to zoom on camera and their inclination is to pinch fingers
Participant captures text through camera and is unsatisfied with legibility
Participant notes that images captured with MR glasses look like they were “taken with a microwave” which is a reference to poor camera quality
Participant hyperaware of dark vignette surrounding screen in MR glasses when capturing images
Participant feels that image quality is blurry and notices that closing left eye helps with image clarity
Participant has just become aware that screen is only on right side
Participant describes a rainbow hue to images and videos
Participant feels a need to squint and get closer to improve clarity of images and videos
Video quality is more washed out than image quality, per participant
Participant notices that video capture is choppy
Participant says that the added layer of movement within MR glasses camera contributes to an increased feeling of motion sickness, eg peering through camera in glasses
Participant notes that pictures are clearer when looking at them through a dark solid background
Participant appreciates the added layer of confirmation before deleting images and notes that it could be easy to make a mistake with hand gestures
Participant expresses desire to have a zoom feature for image capture
Participant describes camera capabilities as dash camera like, stating that it only captures what’s in front of you without other capabilities
Participant doesn’t think that Meta AI does not work well if users are looking for detailed answers and would use it more for quick facts
Participant testing MR glasses capabilities by asking Meta to analyze a setting and suggest new decorative recommendations
Participant wonders if Meta can capture an image and edit that image but discovers that it cannot

Participant working through trade offs - tightening neural band results in increased registering of hand gestures but results in physical discomfort while loosening band reduces physical discomfort at the cost of registering hand gestures
